text: Love what they are trying to do and was really pleased to see my husband enjoyed it too

Whether we agree with the execution or not, they’re tackling a real issue that needs the airtime. The reaction is beyond me & frustrates me as other brands will decide not to address big problems like this for fear of getting it wrong or rinsed in the media. There are literally bigger fish to fry. Also anything that irritates Piers fecking Morgan is alright by me. Good on you for sticking your head above the parapet @gillette

This ad was necessary! It's started a conversation and has planted a seed which will have some really thinking about their behaviour and having a conversation. It's great that trusted companies like Gillette like Nike are using their stature to attempt make social change

makes a change from women having to call-out this behaviour ... unfortunately knee-jerk reactions of jerks is all too predictable ... if only they would just sit with their discomfort for a while .....

Seeing Piers Morgan talk about this yesterday was painful. Not only do i dislike the man but his views on this advert were awful. This advert was made for men like him! So yes anyone who complains about the message it gives off is why the advert was made in the first place.

I love it. We need to start tackling the behaviours that some men possess. They are old fashioned, sexist and not wanted in todays society any longer.  We victim blame far too much and hear the phrases 'boys will be boys' far too often or 'hes a man' like it excuses their behaviour. Well done to Gillett. Great slogan
It feels like a good and genuinely positive gesture.

If it gets the debate started or a conversation going then it's done its job. I once called out a work colleague for being derogatory about Serena Williams, comparing her body to a man's. I said to him, if she walked in right now would you say that to her face? He was a privileged, white, young man and I couldn't bear the sexist / racist undertones of this comment.

The comments on the post on Gillette’s page are a mixture of celebration and exactly those you’d expect from people who are part of the problem. I love the ad. Love it. Glad my son is growing up with stuff like this.

Appropriate! I think it's brilliant. Really recommend everyone (if on twitter) follows Luke and Ryan Hart whose mother and sister were killed by their father (@CoCoAwareness) they have discussed this and generally speak brilliantly on toxic masculinity; the danger of it and how more men should be speaking up on it
